title: Evaluating the Use of Crowdsourcing as a Data Collection Method for Bicycle Performance Measures and Identification of Facility Improvement Needs
text: Transportation Research Board > Blurbs > Evaluating the Use of Crowdsourcing as a Data Collection Method for Bicycle Performance Measures and Identification of Facility Improvement Needs Text Size: | Share: Evaluating the Use of Crowdsourcing as a Data Collection Method for Bicycle Performance Measures and Identification of Facility Improvement Needs http://www.oregon.gov/ODOT/TD/TP_RES/docs/Reports/2015/SPR768_Crowdsourcing_DataCollection.pdf 173157 Evaluating the Use of Crowdsourcing as a Data Collection Method for Bicycle Performance Measures and Identification of Facility Improvement Needs The Oregon Department of Transportation has released a report that explains a smartphone application designed to collect cyclistsâ€™ routes, users, and comfort levels by combining GPS route data with results from surveys of cyclists.   9/10/2015
